Fist.name: Fist
Fist.description: Note: no description was provided for this item
Fist.criticalSpecialization: The target must succeed at a Fortitude save against your class DC or be slowed 1 until the end of your next turn.

Clan Dagger.name: Clan Dagger
Clan Dagger.description: This broad dagger is carried by dwarves as a weapon, tool, and designation of clan. Losing or having to surrender a clan dagger is considered a mark of embarrassment to most dwarves.
Clan Dagger.criticalSpecialization: The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.

Club.name: Club
Club.description: This is a piece of stout wood shaped or repurposed to bludgeon an enemy. Clubs can be intricately carved pieces of martial art or as simple as a tree branch or piece of wood.
Club.criticalSpecialization: You knock the target away from you up to 10 feet (you choose the distance). This is forced movement.

Dagger.name: Dagger
Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.
Dagger.criticalSpecialization: The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.

Gauntlet.name: Gauntlet
Gauntlet.description: A pair of these metal gloves comes with full plate, half plate, and splint armor; they can also be purchased separately and worn with other types of armor. They not only protect your hands but also transform your hands into lethal weapons.
Gauntlet.criticalSpecialization: The target must succeed at a Fortitude save against your class DC or be slowed 1 until the end of your next turn.

Katar.name: Katar
Katar.description: Also known as punching daggers, katars are characterized by their H-shaped hand grip that allows the blade to jut out from the knuckles.
Katar.criticalSpecialization: The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.

Light Mace.name: Light Mace
Light Mace.description: A light mace has a short wooden or metal shaft ending with a dense metal head. Used much like a club, it delivers heavy bludgeoning blows, but with extra power derived from the head’s metal ridges or spikes.
Light Mace.criticalSpecialization: You knock the target away from you up to 10 feet (you choose the distance). This is forced movement.

Longspear.name: Longspear
Longspear.description: This very long spear, sometimes called a pike, is purely for thrusting rather than throwing. Used by many soldiers and city watch for crowd control and defense against charging enemies, it must be wielded with two hands.
Longspear.criticalSpecialization: The weapon pierces the target, weakening its attacks. The target is clumsy 1 until the start of your next turn.

Mace.name: Mace
Mace.description: With a stout haft and a heavy metal head, a mace is sturdy and allows its wielder to deliver powerful blows and dent armor.
Mace.criticalSpecialization: You knock the target away from you up to 10 feet (you choose the distance). This is forced movement.

Morningstar.name: Morningstar
Morningstar.description: This weapon has a short shaft ending in a metal ball studded with spikes.
Morningstar.criticalSpecialization: You knock the target away from you up to 10 feet (you choose the distance). This is forced movement.

Sickle.name: Sickle
Sickle.description: Originally a farming tool used for reaping grain, this one-handed weapon has a short wooden handle ending in a curved blade, sometimes sharpened on both sides.
Sickle.criticalSpecialization: The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.

Spear.name: Spear
Spear.description: A long metal shaft ending with a metal spike, a spear can be used one-handed as a melee weapon and can be thrown.
Spear.criticalSpecialization: The weapon pierces the target, weakening its attacks. The target is clumsy 1 until the start of your next turn.

Spiked Gauntlet.name: Spiked Gauntlet
Spiked Gauntlet.description: Providing the same defensive function as a standard gauntlet, this version has a group of spikes protruding from the knuckles to deliver piercing damage with a punch.
Spiked Gauntlet.criticalSpecialization: The target must succeed at a Fortitude save against your class DC or be slowed 1 until the end of your next turn.

Staff.name: Staff
Staff.description: This long piece of wood can aid in walking and deliver a mighty blow.
Staff.criticalSpecialization: You knock the target away from you up to 10 feet (you choose the distance). This is forced movement.

Bastard Sword.name: Bastard Sword
Bastard Sword.description: This broad-bladed sword, sometimes called the hand‑and‑a‑half sword, has a longer grip so it can be held in one hand or used with two hands to provide extra piercing or slashing power.
Bastard Sword.criticalSpecialization: The target is made off-balance by your attack, becoming flat-footed until the start of your next turn.

Battle Axe.name: Battle Axe
Battle Axe.description: These axes are designed explicitly as weapons, rather than tools. They typically weigh less, with a shaft reinforced with metal bands or bolts, and have a sharper blade, making them ideal for chopping limbs rather than wood.
Battle Axe.criticalSpecialization: Choose one creature adjacent to the initial target and within reach. If its AC is lower than your attack roll result for the critical hit, you deal damage to that creature equal to the result of the weapon damage die you rolled (including extra dice for its potency rune, if any). This amount isn’t doubled, and no bonuses or other additional dice apply to this damage.

Bo Staff.name: Bo Staff
Bo Staff.description: This strong but slender staff is tapered at the ends and well balanced. It’s designed to be an offensive and defensive weapon.
Bo Staff.criticalSpecialization: You knock the target away from you up to 10 feet (you choose the distance). This is forced movement.

Dogslicer.name: Dogslicer
Dogslicer.description: This short, curved, and crude makeshift blade often has holes drilled into it to reduce its weight. It’s a favored weapon of goblins.
Dogslicer.criticalSpecialization: The target is made off-balance by your attack, becoming flat-footed until the start of your next turn.

Elven Curve Blade.name: Elven Curve Blade
Elven Curve Blade.description: Essentially a longer version of the scimitar, this traditional elven weapon has a thinner blade than its cousin.
Elven Curve Blade.criticalSpecialization: The target is made off-balance by your attack, becoming flat-footed until the start of your next turn.

Falchion.name: Falchion
Falchion.description: This weapon is a heavier, two-handed version of the curved-bladed scimitar. It is weighted toward the blade’s end, making it a powerful slashing weapon.
Falchion.criticalSpecialization: The target is made off-balance by your attack, becoming flat-footed until the start of your next turn.

Filcher's Fork.name: Filcher's Fork
Filcher's Fork.description: This halfling weapon looks like a long, two-pronged fork and is used as both a weapon and a cooking implement.
Filcher's Fork.criticalSpecialization: The weapon pierces the target, weakening its attacks. The target is clumsy 1 until the start of your next turn.

Flail.name: Flail
Flail.description: This weapon consists of a wooden handle attached to a spiked ball or cylinder by a chain, rope, or strap of leather.

Glaive.name: Glaive
Glaive.description: This polearm consists of a long, single-edged blade on the end of a 7-foot pole. It is extremely effective at delivering lethal cuts at a distance.
Glaive.criticalSpecialization: The target is moved 5 feet in a direction of your choice. This is forced movement.

Gnome Hooked Hammer.name: Gnome Hooked Hammer
Gnome Hooked Hammer.description: This gnome tool and weapon features a hammer at one end and a curved pick on the other. It’s such a strange and awkward weapon that others think the gnomes are slightly erratic for using it.

Greataxe.name: Greataxe
Greataxe.description: This large battle axe is too heavy to wield with only one hand. Many greataxes incorporate two blades, and they are often “bearded,” having a hook at the bottom to increase the strength of their chopping power.
Greataxe.criticalSpecialization: Choose one creature adjacent to the initial target and within reach. If its AC is lower than your attack roll result for the critical hit, you deal damage to that creature equal to the result of the weapon damage die you rolled (including extra dice for its potency rune, if any). This amount isn’t doubled, and no bonuses or other additional dice apply to this damage.

Greatclub.name: Greatclub
Greatclub.description: While many greatclubs are intricately carved, others are little more than a sturdy tree branch. These massive clubs are too heavy to wield with only one hand.
Greatclub.criticalSpecialization: You knock the target away from you up to 10 feet (you choose the distance). This is forced movement.

Greatpick.name: Greatpick
Greatpick.description: This pick has a longer handle and broader head than a regular pick. It is too heavy to wield in one hand.
Greatpick.criticalSpecialization: The weapon viciously pierces the target, who takes 2 additional damage per weapon damage die.

Greatsword.name: Greatsword
Greatsword.description: This immense two-handed sword is nearly as tall as its wielder. Its lower blade is often somewhat dulled to allow it to be gripped for extra leverage in close-quarter fights.
Greatsword.criticalSpecialization: The target is made off-balance by your attack, becoming flat-footed until the start of your next turn.

Guisarme.name: Guisarme
Guisarme.description: This polearm bears a long, often one‑sided, curved blade with a hook protruding from the blunt side of the blade, which can allow its wielder to trip opponents at a distance. Its shaft is usually 8 feet long.
Guisarme.criticalSpecialization: The target is moved 5 feet in a direction of your choice. This is forced movement.

Halberd.name: Halberd
Halberd.description: This polearm has a relatively short, 5-foot shaft. The business end is a long spike with an axe blade attached.
Halberd.criticalSpecialization: The target is moved 5 feet in a direction of your choice. This is forced movement.

Hatchet.name: Hatchet
Hatchet.description: This small axe can be used in close combat or thrown.
Hatchet.criticalSpecialization: Choose one creature adjacent to the initial target and within reach. If its AC is lower than your attack roll result for the critical hit, you deal damage to that creature equal to the result of the weapon damage die you rolled (including extra dice for its potency rune, if any). This amount isn’t doubled, and no bonuses or other additional dice apply to this damage.

Horsechopper.name: Horsechopper
Horsechopper.description: Created by goblins to battle horses, this weapon is essentially a long shaft ending in a blade with a large hook.
Horsechopper.criticalSpecialization: The target is moved 5 feet in a direction of your choice. This is forced movement.

Kama.name: Kama
Kama.description: Similar to a sickle and used in some regions to reap grain, a kama has a short, slightly curved blade and a wooden handle.
Kama.criticalSpecialization: The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.

Katana.name: Katana
Katana.description: A katana is a curved, single-edged sword known for its wickedly sharped blade.
Katana.criticalSpecialization: The target is made off-balance by your attack, becoming flat-footed until the start of your next turn.

Kukri.name: Kukri
Kukri.description: The blade of this foot-long knife curves inward and lacks a cross guard at the hilt.
Kukri.criticalSpecialization: The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.

Lance.name: Lance
Lance.description: This spear-like weapon is used by a mounted creature to deal a great deal of damage.
Lance.criticalSpecialization: The weapon pierces the target, weakening its attacks. The target is clumsy 1 until the start of your next turn.

Light Hammer.name: Light Hammer
Light Hammer.description: This smaller version of the warhammer has a wooden or metal shaft ending in a metal head. Unlike its heavier cousin, it is light enough to throw.

Light Pick.name: Light Pick
Light Pick.description: A light pick is a modified mining implement with a wooden shaft ending in a pick head crafted more to pierce armor and flesh than chip rocks.
Light Pick.criticalSpecialization: The weapon viciously pierces the target, who takes 2 additional damage per weapon damage die.

Longsword.name: Longsword
Longsword.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two‑edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they’re between 3 and 4 feet in length.
Longsword.criticalSpecialization: The target is made off-balance by your attack, becoming flat-footed until the start of your next turn.

Main-gauche.name: Main-gauche
Main-gauche.description: This parrying dagger features a robust guard to protect the wielder’s hand.
Main-gauche.criticalSpecialization: The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.

Maul.name: Maul
Maul.description: Mauls are massive warhammers that must be swung with two hands.

Nunchaku.name: Nunchaku
Nunchaku.description: The nunchaku is constructed of two wooden or metal bars connected by a short length of rope or chain.
Nunchaku.criticalSpecialization: You knock the target away from you up to 10 feet (you choose the distance). This is forced movement.

Orc Knuckle Dagger.name: Orc Knuckle Dagger
Orc Knuckle Dagger.description: This stout, metal blade of orc design has a horizontal basket hilt with blades jutting from each end, or sometimes one blade like that of a katar.
Orc Knuckle Dagger.criticalSpecialization: The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.

Pick.name: Pick
Pick.description: A pick designed solely for combat has a sturdy wooden shaft and a heavy, pointed head to deliver devastating blows.
Pick.criticalSpecialization: The weapon viciously pierces the target, who takes 2 additional damage per weapon damage die.

Ranseur.name: Ranseur
Ranseur.description: This polearm is a long trident with a central prong that’s longer than the other two.
Ranseur.criticalSpecialization: The target is moved 5 feet in a direction of your choice. This is forced movement.

Rapier.name: Rapier
Rapier.description: The rapier is a long and thin piercing blade with a basket hilt. It is prized among many as a dueling weapon.
Rapier.criticalSpecialization: The target is made off-balance by your attack, becoming flat-footed until the start of your next turn.

Sai.name: Sai
Sai.description: This piercing dagger is a metal spike flanked by a pair of prongs that can be used to trap an enemy’s weapon.
Sai.criticalSpecialization: The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.

Sap.name: Sap
Sap.description: A sap has a soft wrapping around a dense core, typically a leather sheath around a lead rod. Its head is wider than its grip to disperse the force of a blow, as the weapon’s purpose is to knock out its victim rather than to draw blood.
Sap.criticalSpecialization: You knock the target away from you up to 10 feet (you choose the distance). This is forced movement.

Scimitar.name: Scimitar
Scimitar.description: This one-handed curved blade is sharp on one side.
Scimitar.criticalSpecialization: The target is made off-balance by your attack, becoming flat-footed until the start of your next turn.

Scythe.name: Scythe
Scythe.description: Derived from a farming tool used to mow down long grains and cereals, this weapon has a long wooden shaft with protruding handles, capped with a curved blade set at a right angle.
Scythe.criticalSpecialization: The target is moved 5 feet in a direction of your choice. This is forced movement.

Shield Bash.name: Shield Bash
Shield Bash.description: A shield bash is not actually a weapon, but a maneuver in which you thrust or swing your shield to hit your foe with an impromptu attack.
Shield Bash.criticalSpecialization: You knock the target back from you 5 feet. This is forced movement.

Shield Boss.name: Shield Boss
Shield Boss.description: Typically a round, convex, or conical piece of thick metal attached to the center of a shield, a shield boss increases the bludgeoning damage of a shield bash.
Shield Boss.criticalSpecialization: You knock the target back from you 5 feet. This is forced movement.

Shield Spikes.name: Shield Spikes
Shield Spikes.description: These metal spikes are strategically placed on the defensive side of the shield to deal piercing damage with a shield bash.
Shield Spikes.criticalSpecialization: You knock the target back from you 5 feet. This is forced movement.

Shortsword.name: Shortsword
Shortsword.description: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.
Shortsword.criticalSpecialization: The target is made off-balance by your attack, becoming flat-footed until the start of your next turn.

Spiked Chain.name: Spiked Chain
Spiked Chain.description: This 4‑foot‑long length of chain is covered with barbs and has spikes on one or both ends. Some feature metal hoops used as handgrips.

Starknife.name: Starknife
Starknife.description: From a central metal ring, four tapering metal blades extend like points on a compass rose. When gripping a starknife from the center, the wielder can use it as a melee weapon. It can also be thrown short distances.
Starknife.criticalSpecialization: The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.

Temple Sword.name: Temple Sword
Temple Sword.description: This heavy blade is favored by guardians of religious sites. It has a distinctive, crescent-shaped blade that seems to be a mix of a sickle and sword. It often has holes drilled into the blade or the pommel so that bells or other holy trinkets can be affixed to the weapon as an aid for prayer or mediation.
Temple Sword.criticalSpecialization: The target is made off-balance by your attack, becoming flat-footed until the start of your next turn.

Trident.name: Trident
Trident.description: This three-pronged, spear-like weapon typically has a 4-foot shaft. Like a spear, it can be wielded with one hand or thrown.
Trident.criticalSpecialization: The weapon pierces the target, weakening its attacks. The target is clumsy 1 until the start of your next turn.

War Flair.name: War Flair
War Flair.description: This large flail has a long shaft connected to a shorter piece of stout wood or metal that’s sometimes inlaid with spikes.

Warhammer.name: Warhammer
Warhammer.description: This weapon has a wooden shaft ending in a large, heavy metal head. The head of the hammer might be single-sided or double-sided, but it’s always capable of delivering powerful bludgeoning blows.

Whip.name: Whip
Whip.description: This long strand of thick leather, often braided, delivers a painful but nonlethal slash at a distance, usually accompanied by a distinctive cracking sound.

Aklys.name: Aklys
Aklys.description: The aklys is a throwing club with a hook on one end and a lengthy cord attached to the other. Though aklyses aren’t available in most shops, one might be purchased for 5 gp from a vendor that specializes in strange weapons.
Aklys.criticalSpecialization: You knock the target away from you up to 10 feet (you choose the distance). This is forced movement.

Dwarven War Axe.name: Dwarven War Axe
Dwarven War Axe.description: This favored weapon of the dwarves has a large, ornate head mounted on a thick handle. This powerful axe can be wielded with one hand or two.
Dwarven War Axe.criticalSpecialization: Choose one creature adjacent to the initial target and within reach. If its AC is lower than your attack roll result for the critical hit, you deal damage to that creature equal to the result of the weapon damage die you rolled (including extra dice for its potency rune, if any). This amount isn’t doubled, and no bonuses or other additional dice apply to this damage.

Gnome Flickmace.name: Gnome Flickmace
Gnome Flickmace.description: More a flail than a mace, this weapon has a short handle attached to a length of chain with a ball at the end. The ball is propelled to its reach with the flick of the wrist, the momentum of which brings the ball back to the wielder after the strike.

Orc Necksplitter.name: Orc Necksplitter
Orc Necksplitter.description: This single-bladed bearded axe has a jagged blade that’s perfect for separating bone from tendon and cartilage.
Orc Necksplitter.criticalSpecialization: Choose one creature adjacent to the initial target and within reach. If its AC is lower than your attack roll result for the critical hit, you deal damage to that creature equal to the result of the weapon damage die you rolled (including extra dice for its potency rune, if any). This amount isn’t doubled, and no bonuses or other additional dice apply to this damage.

Sawtooth Saber.name: Sawtooth Saber
Sawtooth Saber.description: The signature weapon of the Red Mantis assassins, this curved blade is serrated like a saw, hence the name.
Sawtooth Saber.criticalSpecialization: The target is made off-balance by your attack, becoming flat-footed until the start of your next turn.

Blowgun.name: Blowgun
Blowgun.description: This long, narrow tube is used for shooting blowgun darts, using only the power of a forcefully exhaled breath.
Blowgun.criticalSpecialization: The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.

Crossbow.name: Crossbow
Crossbow.description: This ranged weapon has a bow-like assembly mounted on a handled frame called a tiller. The tiller has a mechanism to lock the bowstring in place, attached to a trigger mechanism that releases the tension and launches a bolt.
Crossbow.criticalSpecialization: If the target of the critical hit is adjacent to a surface, it gets stuck to that surface by the missile. The target is immobilized and must spend an Interact action to attempt a DC 10 Athletics check to pull the missile free; it can’t move from its space until it succeeds. The creature doesn’t become stuck if it is incorporeal, is liquid (like a water elemental or some oozes), or could otherwise escape without effort.

Dart.name: Dart
Dart.description: This thrown weapon is larger than an arrow but shorter than a javelin. It typically has a short shaft of wood ending in a metal tip and is sometimes stabilized by feathers or fur.
Dart.criticalSpecialization: The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.

Hand Crossbow.name: Hand Crossbow
Hand Crossbow.description: Sometimes referred to as an alley bow by rogues or ruffians, this small crossbow fires small bolts that are sometimes used to deliver poison to the target. It’s small enough to be shot one-handed, but it still requires two hands to load.
Hand Crossbow.criticalSpecialization: If the target of the critical hit is adjacent to a surface, it gets stuck to that surface by the missile. The target is immobilized and must spend an Interact action to attempt a DC 10 Athletics check to pull the missile free; it can’t move from its space until it succeeds. The creature doesn’t become stuck if it is incorporeal, is liquid (like a water elemental or some oozes), or could otherwise escape without effort.

Heavy Crossbow.name: Heavy Crossbow
Heavy Crossbow.description: This large crossbow is harder to load and more substantial than a regular crossbow, but it packs a greater punch.
Heavy Crossbow.criticalSpecialization: If the target of the critical hit is adjacent to a surface, it gets stuck to that surface by the missile. The target is immobilized and must spend an Interact action to attempt a DC 10 Athletics check to pull the missile free; it can’t move from its space until it succeeds. The creature doesn’t become stuck if it is incorporeal, is liquid (like a water elemental or some oozes), or could otherwise escape without effort.

Javelin.name: Javelin
Javelin.description: This thin spear is well balanced for throwing but is not designed for melee use.
Javelin.criticalSpecialization: The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.

Sling.name: Sling
Sling.description: Little more than a leather cup attached to a pair of straps, a sling can be used to fling smooth stones or sling bullets at a range.
Sling.criticalSpecialization: The target must succeed at a Fortitude save against your class DC or be stunned 1.

Alchemical Bomb.name: Alchemical Bomb
Alchemical Bomb.description: These bombs come in a variety of types and levels of power, but no matter the variety, you throw the bomb at the target and it explodes, unleashing its alchemical blast.
Alchemical Bomb.criticalSpecialization: Increase the radius of the bomb’s splash damage (if any) to 10 feet.

Composite Longbow.name: Composite Longbow
Composite Longbow.description: This projectile weapon is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Like all longbows, its great size also increases the bow’s range and power. You must use two hands to fire it, and it cannot be used while mounted. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a longbow, such as Erastil’s favored weapon, it also applies to composite longbows unless otherwise stated.
Composite Longbow.criticalSpecialization: If the target of the critical hit is adjacent to a surface, it gets stuck to that surface by the missile. The target is immobilized and must spend an Interact action to attempt a DC 10 Athletics check to pull the missile free; it can’t move from its space until it succeeds. The creature doesn’t become stuck if it is incorporeal, is liquid (like a water elemental or some oozes), or could otherwise escape without effort.

Composite Shortbow.name: Composite Shortbow
Composite Shortbow.description: This shortbow is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Its compact size and power make it a favorite of mounted archers. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a shortbow, it also applies to composite shortbows unless otherwise stated.
Composite Shortbow.criticalSpecialization: If the target of the critical hit is adjacent to a surface, it gets stuck to that surface by the missile. The target is immobilized and must spend an Interact action to attempt a DC 10 Athletics check to pull the missile free; it can’t move from its space until it succeeds. The creature doesn’t become stuck if it is incorporeal, is liquid (like a water elemental or some oozes), or could otherwise escape without effort.

Halfling Sling Staff.name: Halfling Sling Staff
Halfling Sling Staff.description: This staff ends in a Y-shaped split that cradles a sling. The length of the staff provides excellent leverage when used two‑handed to fling rocks or bullets from the sling.
Halfling Sling Staff.criticalSpecialization: The target must succeed at a Fortitude save against your class DC or be stunned 1.

Longbow.name: Longbow
Longbow.description: This 5-foot-tall bow, usually made of a single piece of elm, hickory, or yew, has a powerful draw and is excellent at propelling arrows with great force and at an extreme distance. You must use two hands to fire a longbow, and it can’t be used while mounted.
Longbow.criticalSpecialization: If the target of the critical hit is adjacent to a surface, it gets stuck to that surface by the missile. The target is immobilized and must spend an Interact action to attempt a DC 10 Athletics check to pull the missile free; it can’t move from its space until it succeeds. The creature doesn’t become stuck if it is incorporeal, is liquid (like a water elemental or some oozes), or could otherwise escape without effort.

Shortbow.name: Shortbow
Shortbow.description: This smaller bow is made of a single piece of wood and favored by skirmishers and cavalry.
Shortbow.criticalSpecialization: If the target of the critical hit is adjacent to a surface, it gets stuck to that surface by the missile. The target is immobilized and must spend an Interact action to attempt a DC 10 Athletics check to pull the missile free; it can’t move from its space until it succeeds. The creature doesn’t become stuck if it is incorporeal, is liquid (like a water elemental or some oozes), or could otherwise escape without effort.

Shuriken.name: Shuriken
Shuriken.description: This “throwing star” is a small piece of flat metal with sharp edges, designed to be flung with a flick of the wrist.
Shuriken.criticalSpecialization: The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.

Arrows.name: Arrows
Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.
Arrows.criticalSpecialization: If the target of the critical hit is adjacent to a surface, it gets stuck to that surface by the missile. The target is immobilized and must spend an Interact action to attempt a DC 10 Athletics check to pull the missile free; it can’t move from its space until it succeeds. The creature doesn’t become stuck if it is incorporeal, is liquid (like a water elemental or some oozes), or could otherwise escape without effort.

Blowgun Darts.name: Blowgun Darts
Blowgun Darts.description: These thin, light darts are typically made of hardwood and stabilized with fletching of down or fur. They are often hollow so they can be used to deliver poison.
Blowgun Darts.criticalSpecialization: The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.

Bolts.name: Bolts
Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.
Bolts.criticalSpecialization: If the target of the critical hit is adjacent to a surface, it gets stuck to that surface by the missile. The target is immobilized and must spend an Interact action to attempt a DC 10 Athletics check to pull the missile free; it can’t move from its space until it succeeds. The creature doesn’t become stuck if it is incorporeal, is liquid (like a water elemental or some oozes), or could otherwise escape without effort.

Sling Bullets.name: Sling Bullets
Sling Bullets.description: These are small metal balls, typically either iron or lead, designed to be used as ammunition in slings.
Sling Bullets.criticalSpecialization: The target must succeed at a Fortitude save against your class DC or be stunned 1.
